headerText: The `v-chip` component is used to convey small pieces of information. Using the `close` property, the chip becomes interactive, allowing user interaction. This component is used by the [v-chip-group](/components/chip-groups) for advanced selection options.

usage.desc: Chips come in 4 primary variations. Regular, with icon, with portrait and closeable.

colored.desc: Any color from the Material Design palette can be used to change a chips color.

icon.desc: Chips can use text or any icon available in the Material Icons font library.

outline.desc: Outlined chips inherit their border color from the current text color.

closable.desc: Closable chips can be controlled with a v-model. Listen to the `input` event if you want to know when a chip has been closed.

inSelects.desc: Selects can use chips to display the selected data. Try adding your own tags below.

photos.desc: In this example we opt to use a customized list instead of [v-autocomplete](/components/autocompletes). This allows us to always display the options available while still providing the same functionality of search and selection.

actionChips.desc: Chips can be used as actionable items. Provided with a _click_ event, the chip becomes interactive and can invoke methods.

filtering.desc: Chips are great for providing supplementary actions to a particular task. In this instance, we are searching a list of items and collecting a subset of information to display available keywords.

expandable.desc: Chips can be combined with `v-menu` to enable a specific set of actions for a chip.

playground.desc: Explore the various options available to the `v-chip` component.

props.closeIcon: Change the default icon used for **close** chips
props.disabled: Disables the chip, making it un-selectable
props.filter: Displays a selection icon when selected
props.filterIcon: Change the default icon used for **filter** chips
props.inputValue: Designates whether the component is selected, highlighting the chip
props.label: Removes circle edges
props.link: Explicitly define the chip as a link
props.outline: Removes background and applies border and text color
props.outlined: Removes background and applies border and text color
props.selected: Applies a selection color to the chip. Primarily used for displaying highlight context in `v-select`
